name: Just About Space Stuff Quiz | Astronomy | 10 Questions

questions.text: How much would an astronaut and space suit that weigh 360 pounds on Earth weigh during walks on the moon?
questions.explanation:
60 pounds.

	This is because the gravitational pull on the surface of the moon is about one sixth as strong as it is on Earth.

questions.text: As of 2001, how many space shuttle flights were taken by Dr. Story Musgrave, who has flown on more shuttle missions than anyone else?
questions.explanation:
6.

	He spent a total of 53 days in space aboard the space shuttles Challenger in 1983 and 1985, the Discovery in 1989, Atlantis in 1991, Endeavor in 1993 and Columbia in 1996.

questions.text: What was the only thing that space pioneer John Glenn ate when he became the first American to orbit Earth in 1962?
questions.explanation:
applesauce.

	It came in an aluminum tube.

questions.text: In astronomy, a coma is the vast cloud of light that surrounds a black hole.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Actually it is a luminous cloud of gas and dust around the head of a comet.

questions.text: Which planet has the hottest average surface temperature?
questions.explanation:
Venus.

	Its surface temperature is estimated at 864 degrees F. The high temperature is believed to be the result of a 'greenhouse effect' caused by the layered structure of the planet's clouds and the large proportion of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere.

questions.text: The Finnish stargazers used to call the shooting stars and the comets that they saw "fire foxes."
questions.explanation:
False.

	The Scots used to call it 'merry dancers', what they were seeing was actually the aurora borealis, or northern lights.

questions.text: Which planet's moons are named for characters created by William Shakespeare and Alexander Pope?
questions.explanation:
Uranus.

	Fifteen have been known about for some time. Cordelia, Ophelia, Bianca, Cressida, Desdemona, Juliet, Portia, Rosalind, Belinda, Puck, Miranda, Ariel, Umbriel, Titania, and Oberon. Two recently discovered moons have been named Caliban and Sycoraz.

questions.text: To a shuttle astronaut, Max-Q is the moment about 45 seconds after launch when the shuttle undergoes the maximum amount of air pressure.
An exoplanet is a planet outside our solar system that was once thought to be a moon, but due to advanced systems, has now been determined to actually be a planet.
questions.explanation:
False.

	An exoplanet is any planet that is orbiting a star that is not the Sun -- that is, any planet outside our own solar system. Some exoplanets have been observed directly -- when an exoplanet passes between us and their sun, we can see the silhouette of the exoplanet backlit by their sun. In other words, it is a planet that has not been observed directly, but has been detected by analysis of light from the star it orbits.

questions.text: To an astronaut, 'light the candle' means starting up the shuttle right before they take off.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Really it means to blast off into space.
